description: Inherited from Middle English chalengere, chalangeour; equivalent to challenge +â€Ž -er.

entries.meaning: One who challenges; especially, one who plays against the current champion of a game or contest in hopes of winning and becoming the new champion.
examples: The champion hopes to defeat his new challenger in the game to remain undefeated.
One child stood as king of the hill, and tried to withstand the pushes and shoves of his challengers.
